content.question: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. Let <math alttext="R"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, the fraction 1 over x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, the <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis, and the vertical lines <math alttext="x equals 1"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x equals k"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="k greater than 1"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure above. (a) Find the area of region <math alttext="R"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in terms of <math alttext="k"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

frqParts.text: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. Let <math alttext="R"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, the fraction 1 over x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, the <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis, and the vertical lines <math alttext="x equals 1"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x equals k"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="k greater than 1"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure above. (a) Find the area of region <math alttext="R"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in terms of <math alttext="k"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(b) Write, but do not evaluate, an expression in terms of <math alttext="k"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, involving one or more integrals, that gives the perimeter of region <math alttext="R"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(c) Region <math alttext="R"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is rotated about the <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis to form a solid. As <math alttext="k"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> increases without bound, find the volume of the solid or show that the volume is infinite.

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
